page.title: 09Haddenham Wychert
page.content: Haddenham is famous for its{wychert {walls and houses.}Wychert means{White {Earth (clay).}In the old days Haddenham builders always used wychert because it was{cheap and strong. Wychert is made by{mixing cut straw {with local soil and small stones.}Old builders used to say that "A wall needs a good hat and a strong pair of boots". The walls are built in layers of 60cm, called{'Berries',}and {thatched at the top}(the hat). They were tall to stop animals from eating the thatch! Mr Nelms was one of the last people to build in wychert in Haddenham. The houses in Scotsgrove were the most recent ones built in this way.
